subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Tan, Kim Tian Peranakan clans and associations
physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph, showing a funeral procession. The photograph shows a hearse surrounded by a crowd of people. The men are standing on the left, while the women are standing on the right. The people are wearing mourning garments.
sgcool_label_text: The photograph shows a hearse surrounded by family members of the departed wearing mourning garments, during the funeral of Mrs Tan Bang Wan. This photograph came from the collection of Botan House, the ancestral home built by Tan Kim Tian in 1883 at the corner of Neil Road and Craig Road (since demolished). Together with his son Tan Beng Wan, Tan Kim Tian founded Tan Kim Tian and Son Steamship Company in 1871, which was one of the first in Singapore to buy and build ships. He was also the first president of the Tan clan temple.
title_text: Photograph of a funeral procession Mrs Tan Beng Wan's Funeral Procession
subject_terms_1: photographs Peranakan funeral processions mourning dress hearses
